Author: HoleSearchingJourney

Comment: Cut all discretionary spending and learn to be as frugal as possible.    I never go out except for free events, and I've personally been increasing my pantry stores loading up on foods that'll hold well (canned, pickles, dried goods, noodles, spices).   I expect to see a lot more people struggling economically. I just saw 25% of Americans used "buy now pay later" services like klarna for groceries in the past year, and I've noticed a huge increase in the unhoused in my city over last year.   There's people living out of a minivan in my neighborhood. They ain't drug users and don't cause trouble so I have helped them with food when I can.  As prices increase and recession/depression/crash I'm unsure if I can help those unfortunate folks as before.  Weirds one way to put it!
Author: maninthewoodsdude
